item.description: Podcast Description Communication. Respect. Intimacy. Doing the dishes. Those are all things that have been called the secret to marriage. But Gabrielle Zevin has a different idea. Sandra Oh (“Killing Eve”) reads her piece. Transcript

item.title: Bonus: Test of Time | Modern Love
item.description: Podcast Description We know you appreciate a good love story … so we’re bringing you two stories of relationships that have stood the test of time, from another podcast from WBUR, called “Endless Thread.” Hear the story of the couple featured in an iconic photo from Woodstock, and one about a relationship that started with a note sent in second grade. Transcript

item.title: Single Woman Seeking Manwich | With Awkwafina | Modern Love
item.description: Podcast Description Let’s face it. With the ghosting, inappropriate comments, and awkward small talk … dating can be so bad it’s hilarious. Awkwafina (“Crazy Rich Asians,” “Oceans Eight”) reads Sarah Moses’s essay. Transcript

item.title: When Mothers Bully Back | With Ellie Kemper | Modern Love
item.description: Podcast Description The emotions of parenting can feel completely out of control sometimes. Whether it’s love, joy … or, occasionally, rage. Susan Perabo writes about them in her essay, which is read by Ellie Kemper (“Unbreakable Kimmy Schmidt”). Transcript

item.title: GPS For My Lost Identity | With Diane Guerrero | Modern Love
item.description: Podcast Description Sometimes, our deepest loves aren’t people at all – they’re the places that make us feel most like ourselves. Laura Dave tells a story about one of those places in her essay, which is read by Diane Guerrero (“Orange is the New Black”). Transcript

item.title: Superheroes, Just for Each Other | With Mike Colter | Modern Love
item.description: Podcast Description Peter Goodman thought that he could fix any problem by sweeping his wife off her feet. But when his daughter was born, that strategy failed him. His essay is read by Mike Colter (“Luke Cage.”) Transcript

item.title: A Hiker’s Guide to Healing | With Cameron Esposito | Modern Love
item.description: Podcast Description Aspen Matis decided to hike the Pacific Crest Trail because she was looking for solitude, safety, and escape. She writes about what she found there in her essay, read by actor and comic Cameron Esposito. Transcript

item.title: Catfishing Strangers To Find Myself | With Cory Michael Smith | Modern Love
item.description: Podcast Description As a teenager in Finland, Kalle Oskari Mattila was trying to figure out who he was. For help, he turned to Pamela Anderson. Cory Michael Smith (“1985,” “Gotham”) performed his story live at the Provincetown Film Festival. Transcript

item.title: My Back-Seat View Of A Great Romance | With Chloë Grace Moretz | Modern Love
item.description: Podcast Description “What did it mean that the most romantic thing I’d ever been a part of hadn’t even happened to me?” Chloë Grace Moretz (“The Miseducation of Cameron Post”) reads Rachel Monroe’s essay about watching a love story unfold from the sidelines. Transcript

item.title: Encore | Between The Bars | Modern Love
item.description: Podcast Description Joshua Jackson (“The Affair”) reads a story about life and love after 26 months in Iran’s Evin Prison. This is an encore presentation. Transcript

item.title: The Hunter-Gatherer, Parking Division | With Jason Alexander | Modern Love
item.description: Podcast Description The challenge of finding the perfect partner is matched only by the challenge of finding the perfect parking space in New York City. Jason Alexander (“Seinfeld”) reads Andy Raskin’s essay, about the search for love and parking in Chinatown. Transcript

item.title: Finding My Own Rescuer | With Mandy Moore | Modern Love
item.description: Podcast Description Mandy Moore (“This Is Us”) reads Anna March’s essay about disability, ability, and the misconceptions surrounding both. Transcript

item.title: A Fear Stripped Bare | With Sarah Shahi | Modern Love
item.description: Podcast Description When she was growing up, Susan Sajadi thought that her mother was fearless. It wasn’t until years later that she realized the truth was much more complicated. Her piece is read by Sarah Shahi, who stars in NBC’s “Reverie.” Transcript

item.title: Love Stories In 13 Words | Modern Love Bonus Episode | Modern Love
item.description: Podcast Description For the 13th anniversary of the Modern Love column, readers sent in their love stories, told in just 13 words. More than 9,000 were submitted. We put together an episode featuring some of our favorites. Transcript

item.title: Modern Love Encore | Marry A Man Who Loves His Mother | Modern Love
item.description: Podcast Description Constance Wu of the ABC comedy “Fresh Off The Boat” reads a story about a wife, a mother-in-law and the unlikely story that brought them together. Transcript

item.title: The Language Of Love | With Saoirse Ronan | Modern Love
item.description: Podcast Description Saoirse Ronan (“On Chesil Beach”) reads an essay about how a language barrier impacts the relationship between a young woman and an Iraqi doctor. Transcript

item.title: A Measure of Desire | With Kim Dickens | Modern Love
item.description: Podcast Description Sometimes it’s the things that go unspoken in a relationship that are the most important. Andrea Jarrell found that out not long after moving to Maine with her husband – and she writes about it in her piece, read by Kim Dickens (“Fear the Walking Dead”). Transcript

item.title: When Eve And Eve Bit The Apple | With Rachel Weisz | Modern Love
item.description: Podcast Description Kristen Scharold was an evangelical Christian who was starting to look for a husband. Then, a new relationship caused a crisis of faith. Rachel Weisz (“Disobedience”) reads Kristen’s essay. Transcript

item.title: Signs, Wonders, and Fates Fulfilled | With Linda Cardellini | Modern Love
item.description: Podcast Description After Stephanie Saldaña moved to an ancient monastery in Syria, she thought she’d found her calling. But when she met a novice monk there, she had to rethink everything. Linda Cardellini (“Bloodline”) reads Stephanie’s essay. Transcript

item.title: Boy, What A Fabulous Baker | With Abbi Jacobson | Modern Love
item.description: Podcast Description Abbi Jacobson (“6 Balloons,” “Broad City”) reads an essay about a carboholic who falls for a baker – and his bread. Transcript

item.title: A Cup From The Fountain Of Youth | With Mel Rodriguez | Modern Love
item.description: Podcast Description When you’re at a bar and someone starts paying more attention to you than you expect – how do you react? Mel Rodriguez (“Overboard,” “The Last Man on Earth”) reads Andy Christie’s essay, about trying to navigate an unexpected flirtation. Transcript

item.title: A Brother As Significant As Any Other | With Jeffrey Bowyer-Chapman | Modern Love
item.description: Podcast Description Jeffrey Bowyer-Chapman (“UnREAL”) tells the story of the deep friendship between an older and younger brother. Transcript

item.title: R We D8ting? | With Krysten Ritter | Modern Love
item.description: Podcast Description What happens to relationships when they play out entirely over text? Krysten Ritter (“Jessica Jones”) reads Sandra Barron’s essay, about the miscommunications that can come with text message flirtation. Transcript

item.title: Modern Love Encore: The Boy Who Makes Waves | Modern Love
item.description: Podcast Description In this encore, Mykelti Williamson (“Chicago P.D.”) reads an essay about a father’s complicated love for his son. Transcript

item.title: The Accidental Older Woman | With Rosie Perez | Modern Love
item.description: Podcast Description When does it work to date younger? Rosie Perez, of NBC’s “Rise,” reads Robin Grearson’s essay, about negotiating a relationship with a big age gap. Transcript

item.title: When A Couch Is More Than A Couch | With Kate Winslet | Modern Love
item.description: Podcast Description Kate Winslet reads Nina Riggs’s essay, about an overwhelming diagnosis – and a search for the perfect living room couch. Transcript

item.title: A Fighting Chance | With Bobby Cannavale | Modern Love
item.description: Podcast Description Bobby Cannavale (“Jumanji: Welcome to the Jungle,” “Mr. Robot”) reads Dominick Zarrillo’s essay about a father’s unconditional love for his son. Transcript

item.title: From He To She In First Grade | With Jennifer Beals | Modern Love
item.description: Podcast Description Jennifer Beals (“Taken”) reads Laurie Frankel’s essay, about facing a challenging parenting dilemma. Transcript

item.title: The Accident No One Talked About | With Uma Thurman | Modern Love
item.description: Podcast Description Uma Thurman (“The Parisian Woman”) reads Jessica Ciencin Henriquez’s essay, about the silence that grew in the aftermath of a terrible accident. Transcript

item.title: Overfed On A Mother's Affection | With Kumail Nanjiani and Emily Gordon | Modern Love
item.description: Podcast Description Kumail Nanjiani and Emily Gordon (“The Big Sick”) tell the story of how a mother’s cooking comes between a husband and wife. Transcript

item.title: Missing A Father I Hardly Knew | With Willem Dafoe | Modern Love
item.description: Podcast Description Willem Dafoe (“The Florida Project”) reads Bruce Eric Kaplan’s essay, about waiting for a hilarious secret to be revealed. Transcript

item.title: Modern Love 100: Your Stories | Modern Love
item.description: Podcast Description We celebrate the 100th episode of Modern Love: The Podcast by listening to your stories, and the moments from our first 99 episodes that meant the most to you. Transcript

item.title: A Dose Of Empathy | With Andrea Martin | Modern Love
item.description: Podcast Description Andrea Martin (“Great News”) reads Randi Davenport’s essay, about a relationship that she says saved her life. Transcript

item.title: In My Fantasy, I Caught Up To Reality | With Richard Jenkins | Modern Love
item.description: Podcast Description Richard Jenkins (“The Shape of Water”) reads John Gfroerer’s essay about going to the gym to cope with loss. Transcript

item.title: Yes, We Do. Even At Our Age. | With Lois Smith | Modern Love
item.description: Podcast Description Lois Smith (“Marjorie Prime,” “Lady Bird”) reads an essay about passion in the golden years. Transcript

item.title: In The New Year, More Cuddling | With Margarita Levieva | Modern Love
item.description: Podcast Description Margarita Levieva (“The Deuce”) reads Kristine Lloyd’s essay, about making a New Year’s resolution to attend a cuddle party. Transcript

item.title: Sharing A Cab, And My Toes | With Greta Gerwig | Modern Love
item.description: Podcast Description Greta Gerwig (“Lady Bird”) reads Julia Anne Miller’s essay, about sharing an unusual cab ride in New York City. Transcript

item.title: How The 'Dining Dead' Got Talking Again | With Kristin Scott Thomas | Modern Love
item.description: Podcast Description Kristin Scott Thomas (“Darkest Hour”) reads an essay about a woman worried that she and her husband might have nothing left to talk about. Transcript

item.title: Was I On A Date Or Baby-Sitting? | With Sasheer Zamata | Modern Love
item.description: Podcast Description Julie Klausner tells the story of dating an “indie rock dreamboat” – who she sees as a bit of a man-child. Sasheer Zamata (“United States of Music,” “Pizza Mind”) reads Julie’s essay. Transcript

item.title: A Boyfriend Too Good To Be True | With Caitriona Balfe | Modern Love
item.description: Podcast Description Caitriona Balfe (“Outlander”) reads Deenie Hartzog-Mislock’s essay, about an imaginary man who helps a family cope with Alzheimer’s. Transcript

item.title: Modern Love Encore: 'A Heart Of Gold' | Modern Love
item.description: Podcast Description In this encore, Ruth Negga (“Preacher,” “Loving”) reads a story about the deep bond between a woman and her unusual pet. Transcript

item.title: We Didn't Have A Plan, But The Baby Did | With Paul Sun-Hyung Lee | Modern Love
item.description: Podcast Description Paul Sun-Hyung Lee (“Kim’s Convenience”) reads a story about a man improvising a birth plan. Transcript

item.title: Urgent Messages Go Unanswered | With Andrew Rannells | Modern Love
item.description: Podcast Description Andrew Rannells (“Girls”) reads his own essay, about ignoring a string of urgent phone calls during a casual hookup. Transcript

item.title: A Family Fairytale, Twice Told | With Julia Stiles | Modern Love
item.description: Podcast Description Julia Stiles (“Riviera”) tells the story of a woman who has a perfect New York City apartment … and a crush on her roommate. Transcript

item.title: Cropped Out Of My Own Fantasy | With Kirsten Vangsness | Modern Love
item.description: Podcast Description Kirsten Vangsness (“Criminal Minds”) reads an essay about a relationship where the perfect images posted online don’t match the reality. Transcript

item.title: My Body Doesn't Belong To You | With Cleopatra Coleman | Modern Love
item.description: Podcast Description Cleopatra Coleman (“The Last Man On Earth,” “White Famous”) reads an essay about a woman claiming ownership over her own body. Transcript

item.title: Let's Not Pretend | With Kimberly Hébert Gregory | Modern Love
item.description: Podcast Description Kimberly Hébert Gregory (“Kevin (Probably) Saves the World,” “Vice Principals”) reads an essay about an attempt at dirty talk gone awry. Transcript

item.title: My Husband Is Now My Wife | With Ann Dowd | Modern Love
item.description: Podcast Description Ann Dowd (“The Handmaid’s Tale”) reads Diane Daniel’s essay about a woman coming to terms with her spouse’s gender transition. Transcript

item.title: Nursing A Wound | With Jake Gyllenhaal | Modern Love
item.description: Podcast Description Jake Gyllenhaal (“Stronger”) tells the story of a man recovering from heartbreak in a pediatrics wing. Transcript

item.title: When Your Greatest Romance Is A Friendship | With Ali Fazal | Modern Love
item.description: Podcast Description Ali Fazal (“Victoria and Abul”) tells the story of an unlikely friendship between a man and his elderly neighbor. Transcript

item.title: One Bouquet Of Fleeting Beauty | With Kerry Bishé | Modern Love
item.description: Podcast Description Kerry Bishe (“Halt and Catch Fire,” “Narcos”) tells the story of one woman’s unexpected awakening – at a flower shop. Transcript

item.title: Emmy Edition, 2017 | Modern Love
item.description: Podcast Description The 69th Primetime Emmy Awards are this weekend. To celebrate, we’re looking back at two of our favorite episodes featuring nominated actors. Angela Bassett reads Marcia DeSanctis’ essay, “What the Psychic Knew” and Jesse Tyler Ferguson reads Jerry Mahoney’s essay, “Mom/Not Mom/Aunt.” Transcript

item.title: Promises That Can Bend | With Peter Gallagher | Modern Love
item.description: Podcast Description Peter Gallagher (“Grace and Frankie,” “The O.C.”) reads the story of one man’s effort to stay with his wife in sickness and in health. Transcript

item.title: No Bounds, Or Lanes | With Kyra Sedgwick | Modern Love
item.description: Podcast Description Love, itself, is a leap of faith. But some people take a bigger jump than others. Kyra Sedgwick (TNT’s “The Closer”) reads a story about a “wild ride” of a marriage. Transcript

item.title: Learning To Embrace Sexuality's Gray Areas | With Nico Tortorella | Modern Love
item.description: Podcast Description Nico Tortorella (“Younger”) reads an essay about a college student whose ideas about love and sexuality change during the first weeks of his freshman year. Transcript

item.title: Dear Dad, We've Been Gay Forever | With Cynthia Nixon | Modern Love
item.description: Podcast Description Cynthia Nixon (“The Last Boy in New York,” “A Quiet Passion”) reads an essay about two grown siblings raised in the Mennonite church and their decision to come out to their 95-year-old father. Transcript

item.title: A Lost Child, But Not Mine | With Betty Gilpin | Modern Love
item.description: Podcast Description Betty Gilpin of Netflix’s “G.L.O.W.” reads a story about life after abortion. Transcript

item.title: Flowergate | With June Diane Raphael | Modern Love
item.description: Podcast Description June Diane Raphael of Netflix’s “Grace and Frankie” reads a story about a flower delivery gone very, very wrong. Transcript

item.title: Manic Pixie Dream Girl | With Alex Karpovsky | Modern Love
item.description: Podcast Description Alex Karpovsky of HBO’s “Girls” tells the story of one man’s quest to turn his love life into a cinematic event. Transcript

item.title: I Need To Woman Up | With Cynthia Addai-Robinson | Modern Love
item.description: Podcast Description We can’t control the curve balls life throws at us, but we can control how we handle them. Cynthia Addai-Robinson (USA Network’s “Shooter”) reads a story about choosing to face one of life’s greatest challenges alone. Transcript

item.title: An Empty Heart | With Zoe Lister-Jones | Modern Love
item.description: Podcast Description Zoe Lister-Jones (“Band Aid,” “Life in Pieces”) reads renowned novelist Lily King’s story about the silver lining of heartbreak. Transcript

item.title: Take My Son To Jail | With Jayne Atkinson | Modern Love
item.description: Podcast Description Jayne Atkinson (“House of Cards”) tells the story of a mother who reluctantly uses tough love when her son refuses to follow the law. Transcript

item.title: Modern Love Encore: Wedding Season | Modern Love
item.description: Podcast Description It’s wedding season! Kathryn Hahn (“I Love Dick”) and John Cho (“Star Trek”) read some of our favorite nuptial-themed essays. Transcript

item.title: About That Rustle In The Bushes | With Danielle Brooks | Modern Love
item.description: Podcast Description Danielle Brooks of “Orange Is The New Black” on a daughter’s discovery of her father’s secret investigative skills. The target? Her boyfriends. Transcript

item.title: Before The Web | With Griffin Dunne | Modern Love
item.description: Podcast Description Griffin Dunne of the Amazon series “I Love Dick” reads a story about how distance can make the heart grow discouragingly fonder. Transcript

item.title: Finding Marriage, Losing Self | With Taylor Schilling | Modern Love
item.description: Podcast Description Taylor Schilling of “Orange is the New Black” reads a story about unpacking the baggage of your past in a new relationship. Transcript

item.title: Standing By Your Man | With Chris Messina | Modern Love
item.description: Podcast Description Chris Messina of “The Mindy Project” and “The Sweet Life” reads a story that explores what it really means to stand by your partner “in sickness and in health.” Transcript

item.title: Marry My Husband | With Debra Winger | Modern Love
